html:
** J.P. Morgan upgrades telecoms company shares AAF.L to "overweight" from "neutral"; shares jump 3.7% to 86p, tops FTSE 250 .FTMC index

** JPM also raises PT by 28p to 100p, implying an upside of 20.6% as of stock's last close

** Brokerage says PT raise on expected cash receipts related to recent minority stake sales in the mobile money business ($300 mln) to Mastercard MA.N, private equity firm TPG and sale of tower assets ($200 mln) to Helios Towers HTWS.L, reducing net debt significantly to $2.7 bln (Full Story)

** "AAF is also exposed to a longer term mobile money opportunity in East and Francophone Africa and Nigeria, should the Nigerian government award mobile money licenses"

** Brokerage expects Nigerian subscriber churn to be mitigated by rising ARPU in the near term; adds, recent deadline extension of NIN registration shows risk of disorderly subscriber disconnections is declining

** Three of 9 brokerages rate the stock "buy" or higher, 5 "hold" and 1 "sell"; their median PT is $80.55p - Refinitiv Eikon data

** Shares up 13.6% for the year


(Reporting by Devik Jain in Bengaluru)

(( Devik.Jain@thomsonreuters.com ; within U.S. +1 646 223 8780; outside U.S. +91 80 6182 2062; ;))
